columns.text: The goal of this task is to classify the acquisition and explain how the nationality of the company being acquired influences decision-making.

First, let's remember some basic concepts!

***When are we in the presence of a horizontal acquisition?***

Let us remember that when a company in the same sector is acquired, that is to say, when it coincides in the same product line and they may share the same market, and they could be competitors, in this case, we say that a **horizontal acquisition** has taken place.

***When are we in the presence of a vertical acquisition?***

When a company from a different position in the supply chain is acquired, then we say that a **vertical acquisition** has taken place.
So, we can say that ***Suntory Holdings Ltd. has made a horizontal acquisition by acquiring a company in the same sector, even if they do not necessarily compete in the same market**.

Now, ***how does the nationality of the acquired company affect the decision?***

In some sources, we will find that some classify acquisitions according to **market extension**. And that is precisely what is happening here!

In this case, both companies are in the same product line but are not necessarily competitors as they may be in different markets.

So, ***What are the benefits of acquiring a company of another nationality?***

Well, the acquired company can continue to operate in its market with its products or services. The difference is that it is now owned by another company, in this case, a Japanese company. 

Also, note that this acquisition avoids the threat of future competition and, at the same time, allows Suntory Holdings Ltd. to penetrate a new market without the high cost and risk of introducing new products competing with established and recognized companies.

From this perspective, we can say that for Suntory Holdings Ltd. to acquire a U.S. company can be a great strategic step! and we agree that the nationality of the acquired company can be a very important element in the decision to acquire it.

textbook.authors: Bradford D. Jordan, Randolph W. Westerfield, Stephen A. Ross
